episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including British children digging massive beach holes, the role of goose feathers in the Hundred Years' War, Lucille Ball's radio-receiving teeth, and the peculiar smell of Queen Elizabeth II's car.

facts.fact: British children have been asked to stop digging holes on beaches after they dug one so big, it had to be filled in with a forklift truck.
During the Hundred Years' War, every goose in England had to donate six feathers to the war effort.
American comedian Lucille Ball's teeth could play the latest pop songs and bust Japanese spies.
The smelliest car at the British Motor Museum belongs to Queen Elizabeth II.
